subject: Technology
title: TCP/IP: The Universal Language
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: TCP/IP: The Universal Language.

hook.text: Early networks were like countries with different languages. They could not understand each other.

buildup.text: Each network had its own rules for sending data. Connecting them seemed nearly impossible.

discovery.text: Vint Cerf and Bob Kahn created TCP/IP, a universal protocol any network could adopt.

twist.text: TCP/IP didn't care what hardware you used. It gave every device a common way to communicate.

climax.text: On January 1, 1983, ARPANET switched to TCP/IP. That date is called the internet's birthday.

punchline.text: One shared language connected the entire world.

quiz.question: What did TCP/IP accomplish?
options: Let different networks communicate using one protocol
